def: Disinterested. [Obs.]The measures they shall walk by shall be disinterest and even. Jer.Taylor.
To dismiss, let go, or release. [Obs.]
A weak nitrogenous sulphur base, C6H13NS2.
One who uses or interprets figurative expressions. Waterland.
A genus of trees growing naturally on the Andes in Peru andadjacent countries, but now cultivated in the East Indies, producinga medicinal bark of great value.
Apt to suspect or mistrust; full of suspicion; suspicious; as,to be suspectful of the motives of others. Milton.-- Sus*pect"ful*ness, n.

An ancient instrument of music with six strings; a kind ofviolin, being the oldest known stringed instrument played with a bow.[Written also croud, crowth, cruth, and crwth.]A lackey that . . . can warble upon a crowd a little. B. Jonson.
A system of signaling in which balls of red and green fire arefired from a pistol, the arrangement in groups denoting numbershaving a code significance.

[fragrans. -antis, p.pr. of fragrare to emit a smell offragrance: cf. OF. fragrant. Affecting the olfactory nervesagreeably; sweet of smell; odorous; having or emitting an agreeableperfume.Fragrant the fertile earth After soft showers. Milton.
With the flat side downward, or next to another object; notedgewise.
One who utters falsehoods; a liar.
